title: How to Add Sentiment Analysis to Any App in 5 Minutes
body_markdown:
# Add Sentiment Analysis to Any App in 5 Minutes

Most apps already collect text: reviews, support tickets, chat logs, survey responses, and more. The problem is they rarely **measure** what people feel.

In this quick guide, we will wire up a simple API that turns any free text into:

- Overall sentiment (positive, neutral, negative)
- Polarity and subjectivity scores
- Emotion hints (joy, anger, fear, trust)
- Keywords and key phrases

## 1. Get an API key

Subscribe to the **Text Sentiment & NLP Insights API** on RapidAPI and copy your key.

## 2. Make your first request (JavaScript)

```javascript
fetch("https://text-sentiment-nlp-insights-api.p.rapidapi.com/v1/basic", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    "content-type": "application/json",
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "YOUR_KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "text-sentiment-nlp-insights-api.p.rapidapi.com"
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({ text: "I love how easy this is to use." })
})
  .then(res => res.json())
  .then(console.log);
```

## 3. Example use cases

- Rank customer reviews by sentiment
- Flag angry or frustrated support tickets
- Track the emotional tone of community feedback over time

Once it is wired in, you can treat the API as a simple scoring function wherever you already handle text.

title: Building a Lightweight NLP Analytics Layer with One API
body_markdown:
# Building a Lightweight NLP Analytics Layer with One API

You do not need a full ML team to get value from NLP.

With a single HTTP endpoint you can:

- Score sentiment on every piece of feedback
- Extract entities and keywords
- Enrich your dashboards with emotional context

This article walks through wiring the **Text Sentiment & NLP Insights API** into an existing analytics pipeline using Python and a cron job.

```python
import requests

url = "https://text-sentiment-nlp-insights-api.p.rapidapi.com/v1/advanced"

payload = {
    "text": "The service was slow at first, but the support team was very helpful."
}
headers = {
    "content-type": "application/json",
    "X-RapidAPI-Key": "YOUR_KEY",
    "X-RapidAPI-Host": "text-sentiment-nlp-insights-api.p.rapidapi.com"
}

r = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers)
print(r.json())
```

From there you can push results into your warehouse or BI tool.
